channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Mother of Georgia shooting suspect called school to warn of emergency, aunt says
item.description: The mother of the suspect had called the Georgia high school before the fatal shooting of four people, warning staff of an “extreme emergency” involving her son, a relative told the Washington Post.
item.content:encoded:
The mother of the suspect had called the Georgia high school before the fatal shooting of four people, warning staff of an “extreme emergency” involving her son, a relative told the Washington Post.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 3 Israelis killed in attack at West Bank-Jordan border crossing, Israeli military says
item.description: The Israeli military said a gunman approached the Allenby Bridge Crossing from the Jordanian side in a truck and opened fire at Israeli security forces, who killed the assailant in a shootout.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military said a gunman approached the Allenby Bridge Crossing from the Jordanian side in a truck and opened fire at Israeli security forces, who killed the assailant in a shootout.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Here’s where Trump and Harris stand on 6 education issues
item.description: From school choice to college affordability, Trump and Harris don't have a lot in common. Ahead of the candidates’ only scheduled debate, we’ve put together a handy primer of their education views.
item.content:encoded:
From school choice to college affordability, Trump and Harris don't have a lot in common. Ahead of the candidates’ only scheduled debate, we’ve put together a handy primer of their education views.

(Image credit: LA Johnson)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Venezuelan opposition candidate González has left the country for asylum in Spain
item.description: The departure of Edmundo González, who Venezuela’s opposition and several foreign governments consider the legitimate winner of July’s presidential race, was announced by Venezuela's vice president.
item.content:encoded:
The departure of Edmundo González, who Venezuela’s opposition and several foreign governments consider the legitimate winner of July’s presidential race, was announced by Venezuela's vice president.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Police search for suspect following Kentucky shooting that injured multiple people
item.description: Five people were seriously injured in a shooting on a highway north of London, Ky., on Saturday, the Laurel County Sheriff’s Office said. Authorities are searching for one suspect.
item.content:encoded:
Five people were seriously injured in a shooting on a highway north of London, Ky., on Saturday, the Laurel County Sheriff’s Office said. Authorities are searching for one suspect.

(Image credit: Camden Mink)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: A Florida high school football player died after collapsing during a game
item.description: The fatal collapse of Chance Gainer, a senior at Port St. Joe High School, is the latest in a string of recent deaths of young football players. Seven school athletes died last month.
item.content:encoded:
The fatal collapse of Chance Gainer, a senior at Port St. Joe High School, is the latest in a string of recent deaths of young football players. Seven school athletes died last month.

(Image credit: Kolbie Jones)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka beats Jessica Pegula to win her first US Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus got past American Jessica Pegula to win her first U.S. Open women’s title and third career Grand Slam title.
item.content:encoded:
Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus got past American Jessica Pegula to win her first U.S. Open women’s title and third career Grand Slam title.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin II)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 一位高调批评中共的异议人士会设下骗局吗？
item.description: 一位广为人知的中国共产党批评者现在被指欺诈
item.link: https://www.npr.org/2024/09/07/g-s1-20881/中国共产党-荷兰-王靖渝-欺诈
item.guid: https://www.npr.org/2024/09/07/g-s1-20881/中国共产党-荷兰-王靖渝-欺诈
item.content:encoded:
一位广为人知的中国共产党批评者现在被指欺诈

item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: A salmonella outbreak linked to recalled eggs sickens people in 9 states
item.description: Eggs branded Milo's Poultry Farms and Tony's Fresh Market were recalled after they were linked to a salmonella outbreak that has hospitalized at least 24 people.
item.content:encoded:
Eggs branded Milo's Poultry Farms and Tony's Fresh Market were recalled after they were linked to a salmonella outbreak that has hospitalized at least 24 people.

(Image credit: U.S. Food and Drug Administration)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Dick Cheney says he will vote for Harris
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney said his decision had to do with Trump's attempts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.
item.content:encoded:
Former Vice President Dick Cheney said his decision had to do with Trump's attempts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.

(Image credit: Money Sharma)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
